page.title: 11HEALTH
page.content: People travel to the health centre next to Stratton hospital, or they may consult a doctor in Kilkhampton, where he has the use of a private house four afternoons a week.First babies are born in hospital in Barnstaple.If there are no complications,subsequent children may be born at Stratton or at home. Several specialists hold clinics at Stratton, which is also used for 20 patients and where casualty services are available. Major operations are performed at Barnstaple, Exeter or Plymouth. Elderly and handicapped people are cared for in private homes in the area or in the County Council home in Bude, from which a meals-on-wheels service is run.A home help service is operated from Bude. Mental patients are treated at a hospital in Bodmin.
